page.title: 15Local news
page.content: The point-to-point races are held annually in Farmacaffley. The racing starts at 3.00p.m. with the hunt race, which is sponsored by a local garage. This year it was sponsored by JOSHUA WHITE LIMITED. Although it is a small race meeting, it still holds a lot of local interest. There are 5 different races held, which are the Hunt Race, Leeman's Open Chase and Light Weight Race. Every half hour there is a different race. They do two half circuits each one of 2 miles. The fences must be inspected by a representative from the Turf Club. Armagh Farmacaffley won the Point-to-point races the year before last (1983). The fences are built by Mark Bloomer. The secretary of the Point-to-point races is Mr B. Dougan.
